source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Santalum
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Santalum. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves with flat margins, more or less concolorous; fruit 7–30 mm diam., blue, red, brownish or purplish; shrubs or small trees from northern and north-western Victoria
Leaves with recurved to revolute margins, discolorous; fruit 6–8 mm diam., blue or purplish; rare shrub of far East Gippsland
Flowers 2–3.5 mm long; disc obscurely lobed; fruit 15–30 mm diam
Flowers 4–8 mm long; disc with prominent lobes; fruit 7–10 mm diam.; extremely rare tree from the Wangaratta and Robinvale areas
Leaves always opposite, 3–9 cm long, 3–15 mm wide, not uncinate; stigma 2-lobed; perianth persistent in fruit; ripe fruit sweet
Leaves often in threes, 1.5–3.5 cm long, 1.5–4 mm wide, uncinate; stigma 3-lobed; perianth deciduous in fruit; ripe fruit very bitter
